Review.Titre: These things make it go from great, to meh.
Review.Contenu: I've been using Wix for a while now and have gotten on with it really well, I find that the customisability is far better than competitors like Shopify and others. However, there are a few major issues I have with Wix, the first one being that you cannot remove billing fields from the checkout page, I sell digital products so all I need is their email address and country, the unneeded information required is is giving my customers a terrible user experience and would hate to think how much revenue i've lost because of this. I don't even use Wix as a payment processor, I use Stripe, they have this feature, WHY can't I remove these fields if you don't manage my payments???Secondly, not being able to edit individual product pages, I have different products, I NEED to add different features to each product, yes I know you can use the product editor to add details but I need to specifically edit the page.Thirdly, not being able to add options to digital products, I have one single digital product with 12 options, I have to list these all as separate products! This is inconvenient and I really don’t understand why this isn’t available, it’s such a simple thing, so, why?These issues are having a HUGE impact on my conversion rate.The only other thing I have to say that isn't the greatest is the constant bombardment of emails to upgrade my plan, today only! (sends everyday) I understand this is just marketing and I myself use tactics like this but sending me these emails everyday is just excessive.I think it's time for me to move on from Wix, it's a shame as it is a great platform apart from a few shortcomings.Edit: just something to add to this, I am now experiencing buggy pages on my Wix website, I have not changed anything that would cause this and my customers are having to refresh multiple times just to see the page! This is losing me revenue now, time to move on.

The Mobile app to manage your business is also very basic and very often gets stuck or crash. I wish Wix all the best with building their product, but I have to warn those who are building theirs with them.

Wix has been great to help me learn the ropes of eCommerce web dev, but honestly, the product is overpriced, overhyped and under-performs. Lack of robust currency management, restricted templates, additional costs for basic automation, very poor SEO / indexing performance, clunky click and drop UI, lack of true tablet responsiveness, lack of language-based sitemaps, expensive Facebook CPM/CPC's and a weird pay upfront media cost on a rolling subscription model. It should be known that Facebook operate a post-pay model and their CPM's are a fraction of what WIX charges - They pocket both interest on the balance, and the increase on the CPM's (cost of media is inflated). Anyone with an understanding of Business Ads Manager will know that the WIX product for social ads is a complete rip-off. The cost of a month's subscription gets you a fabulous Wordpress / WooCommerce template. If you've got some base skills or access to a developer, and the willingness to scale your business, look elsewhere. If you want something super basic, super 'managed' with minimal customisation or personalisation then Wix is your go-to. Good luck scaling a business that won't rank on Google and looks like every other basic, failed, online business. I tried getting support with GA4 tracking issues, the customer service team were friendly but useless. Avoid WIX - It's not saving you money, or time.UPDATE: One month laterSwitched to WordPress, 65 of 120 pages are now indexed and ranking well on Google where previously only 8/100 pages were indexed. SEO performance has massively improved.

Review.Titre: Poor SEO ranking on Google for key words.
Review.Contenu: I have revised my review after Wix have now resolved my billing issue, however the platform still has many other drawbacks.Firstly, contrary to all the adverts, I find Wix has extremely poor SEO on Google and its been 12 months now without improvement, most platforms get their website ranked within 6-weeks.When my client was on WordPress, he ranked top in Google for various key-word searches, sadly thats not the case with Wix. And my client no longer receives any regular enquiries like before, its probably lost him a lot of custom and he regrets leaving WordPress, and he wants to migrate back to the said platform understandably.I asked an independent web-developer to examine the back-end of my website and they noticed Wix websites are missing much of the crucial code in the back-end for Google to effectively index and crawl your website. When seeing how slow images load on my Wix website, its no surprise Google probably ranks it lower as well. And for the avoidance of doubt we completed the Wix SEO checklist and set-up Google search console and analytics.The technology stack on WordPress seems to be much more Google friendly being its an open-source CMS platform, however the downside being its not as straight-forward to use as Wix, however my client has no choice but to return to WordPress given Wix failed to rank his website in Google and he has virtually zero-traffic going to his website compared to his previous website on WordPress.To put it simply, Wix is much easier for building websites because of its intuitive interface and its drag-n-drop style ***however*** the trade-off seems to be poor SEO, random formatting glitches and less-professional aesthetic compared to commercial websites. On a seperate note, Wix does seem to have good website security which is something.

Review.Titre: Not as easy as they make out
Review.Contenu: I enjoyed designing the website, however it was a lot more difficult than the 'drag and drop' advertised.  Also, when the website went live, the images and text sometimes overlapped.  At first I thought this was an error on my part but when checking the website at other times, the website was as I published it.

Review.Titre: Easy to use but some issues
Review.Contenu: It's an easy website to use to build a few of my own. However, after some software updates, it no longer works on my Mac with Safari and I've had to resort to using another browser. Wix suggested several steps to try to fix it, but the one I don't want to try is deleting Safari and reinstalling it (I'm not too sure where to find it if it's not in the App Store).  Also, I think there aren't enough coupon options so that part of the ecommerce offering is quite limited.

Review.Titre: Easy to set up, too bad about portability
Review.Contenu: This is an easy template to set up an amazing looking website. Unfortunately, I am disappointed in the viewing of this site on a device such as phone or tablet. It works well on desktop or laptop but doesn't convert well on a device. In this day and age with today's technology, this portability is essential.

Review.Titre: Great for beginners, but SLOW with photos.
Review.Contenu: I love that I can drag and drop on wix. Now that I've learned to use it (which didn't take long), I feel like I can make any vision I have happen on there, which is excellent. BUT the photo editor is PAINFULLY slow. I wait for approximately 10 seconds for a photo that is already uploaded to appear on in the editing window. It reminds me of the dial-up days and I wonder why they haven't figured this out yet. For this reason, I will seriously consider a different website builder next time I'm shopping.

Relatively happy with the site but not happy that they charged me to renew my domain for a full year 2 days before cancelling it (because I wasn't using it and had not registered it). When I applied for a refund since they charged me for a full year for 2 days worth, it was denied.

Review.Titre: Missing features do not get Wix to the challenge
Review.Contenu: The Wix editor has come a long way, but still needs so many improvements.  There are many mouse rollover options missing, styling of text and graphics is complicated within many dialog boxes, options are hidden, elements do not snap to guides correctly, grouping is needed, masking is needed, transparency control is not fully developed. Hiding footer and not header. And more....  but I don't get the feel that your tech people are aware of these comments. Also communicating with Wix needs ASAP a 24/7 chat onine.

Ok ! So I wrote here previously in my frustration with Wix ! Now finally the issues I had with Wix have been resolved thanks to Claire their case manager . She went above and beyond to help fix the outstanding issues ! What I will say is that Wix should simplify it's 3 editors scenario as it's confusing , especially when you switch between them only to realise that doing so cancels the other out . I give Wix 4 stars for its platform , fix the editing and removal of comments and you will get 5 stars As for customer service in Claire's case 5 stars , if the rest of Wix callback team get up to that level of simplicity it would be good . Sometimes you need actual explanation as well as instruction to make Wix work properly but my problem has been resolved 👍

Review.Titre: Great website builder, bad customer service
Review.Contenu: Great website builder but customer service is not good at all. They do not resolve any issues and they are negligent with credit card information. Review.Titre: Easy to customize but not as easy to optimize
Review.Contenu: I really like the ease of use and the ability to customize my website however getting it to show on search engines is a problem. I have followed all of the suggestions and still can't find it with a search. I've used it for almost two years and just give my customers a direct link.

As a (more than one) website owner and as one that has been with you for many years (since the flash version...), on one hand I have the feeling that your platform is good (but not enough yet) and on the other hand your (premium) customer service is terrible and mostly based on "copy & paste answers" that almost every time makes me angry and only then you get to be so kind to give a damn... You still have a long way to go until you will be serious enough regarding the above. Looking forward to your total improvements.

WIX is by far one of the user friendly site creator's i have ever seen. I have created a site,purchased premium plan and got a free domain which was all good and a dream come true for me. But later i was facing SEO issues. You can't change your SEO's Meta-tag data(Title, Description) after your site went live/Published.This is a major drawback. And customer support is very much average as it takes days longer to get a reply but you'll get a reply for sure. Poor SEO functioning and Customer service made me to back off. Good thing is they refunded as promised as i cancelled within trial period.

I have noticed the live site doesn't always match up to the edit page, which is annoying. I contacted customer services and they phoned me within 10 minutes, so that was good. They didn't resolve my problem, I however did. As we were conversing I found a way to correct the issue myself. It is simple to use and is good for a personal website or an advert for your business. Looking at the other reviews it seems its not good for anything more than that. I do like the ease of use and the vector art.

I am hugely surprised at all the bad reviews both on trustpilot and other review platforms. I was literally about to hit the pay button and paused for a moment........opened a new tab and searched wix reviews. Safe to say i won't be upgrading now.Which is a massive shame because i have built the website with products etc and spent a good few days working on it. Its also a shame because i found the whole experience of building the site very good, it was easy to do (although i am experienced in website creation) and i found everything worked well as it should. Review.Titre: Initial problems resolved with a simple phone call to a supportive help line
Review.Contenu: Automated responses to queries was frustrating for someone like me. ( a 76 yr. old).  I purchased a domain name with a premium unlimited subscription, as I had understood the site would be easy to set up. I then purchased a mail box and had great difficulty getting Google to verify the domain name.For someone with limited online expertise I found the site tricky to navigate, but once I managed to find the help line was saved from the muddle I was in by a very kind, and efficient lady. I have still to complete the set up of the site but feel much more confident that help is at hand when required. I am on vacation at the moment and when I  complete the site will give a fuller review. In the meantime. Thank you Wix.
Easy to make websites with zero coding knowledge. But templates are inflexible. It's hard to make changes. And if you want to anything minor complicated, you would have to pay for extra options.

Review.Titre: I have used Wix for a number of years…
Review.Contenu: I have used Wix for a number of years now.  Generally I have been very happy with their service and my website.Their templates are easy to use and I love all the various options for styles and layout. But sadly, this last week, my experience changed. After much deliberation, I upgraded my site to enable me to make bookings and accept payments.  What a nightmare!  I have encountered numerous issues with setting up my booking services and found that the amount of booking features offered was seriously lacking. The staff I have spoken to (and there have been many) have been kind and really tried to help me, but at the end of the day- there seem to be some major design flaws.  If you are considering opting for this package, I would encourage you to look elsewhere.

Review.Titre: Mainly Good, But Could Do Better!
Review.Contenu: Overall, works well and is fairly intuitive to build. During the 'go live' phase, unlike some reviewers, I found the customer service to be helpful and efficient. However, my one gripe - and it is a major one - is Wix Payments. Following a transaction, it takes 8 days to get an acknowledgment and then many more before the payment actually reaches your bank account. Where an organisation is dependent on cashflow for survival, this could make the difference between survival and failure. A second, smaller issue, is that the fulfilment apps are mainly geared to North America and don't work in the UK. Come on Wix....if you want to achieve word of mouth recommendation, you need to get your customers to like and respect you - not be irritated by you for hanging onto their money!

Review.Titre: Wix charged me for no reason?
Review.Contenu: UPDATE: They reached out to me and looked into the issue. It seems like they are now aware of the problems many people are having and making an effort to fix their customer service, so I'll give them that.My subscription for a domain was due to renew at the end of this month. WIX already took my money in September BEFORE THE ACTUAL RENEWAL DATE. I talked to a customer service representative who told me that it would be fine but it immediately got denied. They are saying one thing on the phone, and a completely different thing on emails? Trust and accountability are important for customers to continue using a platform and Wix has potential, but they've completely ruined it with their fraudulent practices.I strongly discourage anyone from using this site and avoid it at all costs.

UPDATE: Within one week of writing this review the issue was finally resolved WITHOUT having to hire an attorney. I am increasing my stars to reflect such. However, I cannot give full stars because the amount of stress this experience caused me was ridiculous. ORIGINAL REVIEW: I've been using WIX for almost 3 years and they completely screwed me over! Review.Titre: Building a site is simple, contacting them less so...
Review.Contenu: I wrote a scathing review of Wix as I couldn't get hold of anyone to discuss a problem. They responded to my review here, and looked into my problem, and sorted it.I still, however, find the fact that I had to post here to get in touch very frustrating and find their chatbot method of contacting pretty awful as it's limited to a set list of problems and issues, and if yours isn't there, you end up in a dead-end with no way forward.And numerous attempts to contact via Twitter went unresponded to.But they have looked into my issue now and the world is good again. So, from 1 star to 3,  with room for improvement (like a contact number!). I can't criticise the actual platform and simplicity of building the site, and the SEO functions are pretty good. I'm committed for three years, so we'll see how things go...

Review.Titre: BRAIN DEAD SUPPORT bit nice website building options.
Review.Contenu: I like the options and results but support is lacking. Review.Titre: Could be great, but flaws in basic functionality
Review.Contenu: I've been with Wix for about 8 years now over a number of different projects. I use them primarily because of the ease of building a website.  However there are a number of areas with core functionality that need improving. Sharing to social media from a Wix site is hit and miss, it simply doesn't work on LinkedIn or G+. Similarly, if you are using the blog function on wix, expect the page to take an absolute age to load. I have also found some of the simple add on modules do not work either. The cookies / privacy pop up actually imprinted a piece of text in the middle of my site and popped up on every page, regardless of how many times i clicked to exit. Am i a WIX fan - in short "no", but my website is here now and it would be a real pain to move it
Correct me if I'm wrong, but wasn't the whole "eclipse" thing meant to be optional? I clearly remember that being said, why are you making it mandatory.

Review.Titre: Lacks support, still easy to use and design
Review.Contenu: Lacking customer support, but easy to use and intuitive. 3 out of 5 seems very fair to me :) Won't make anything too amazing and specific, but website looks clean :)

Review.Titre: Wix should be the best Web Hosting - if management wasn't so poor.
Review.Contenu: Wix should completely dominate the web hosting industry because it has so many great features to customize your site, but there seems to be somewhat of a problem in the area of dysfunctional management.  The people running this outfit don't seem to be playing with a full deck and are not capable of solving customer complaints,  The image viewer on this site doesn't display images correctly, however there is a way to compensate for this, but Wix staff don't offer effective and competent technical advice.  I get my hosting for free, which is probably a good idea given the large number of complaints from people paying money for plans that are worthless.  To sum it all up Wix really is great as long as you don't pay for one of their premium plans and figure out how to get adequate image viewing quality.

Review.Titre: Fine - until you have a problem
Review.Contenu: I was happy with my Wix website until on the 28th January I realized I no longer received emails telling me when I had a sale (luckily Stripe and PayPal told me funds were in). Then I noticed messages from customers were not being forwarded either.I contacted Customer Support, and after asking if I had changed any settings or my email address (no) and had I checked my Junk folder (yes) they told me it was a problem with my email server who must be blocking Wix.I contacted Outlook.com. They were very helpful, told me how to check for blocked/safe senders, and said they did not block Wix.Wix seemed to have given up. I chased them this week, and got the same old story that Outlook was blocking the emails. Really? Why would they suddenly start doing that? And in any case Outlook has assured me they don't.Something has broken on my site, and Wix is in denial mode. I'm having to check my site twice daily in case I miss a customer message. Not ideal.

Review.Titre: Terrible customer service, refund policy is a disgrace. (Worked out in the end, see update)
Review.Contenu: I was unable to try the platform out within the 14-day refund window because I was severely ill.  Once I got a chance to try it out I found the user-friendliness to be dreadful. I asked for a pro-rata refund (not a full one) for the remainder of my 2-year purchase.  i.e) WIX would make money for my usage thus far, but give a partial refund for the rest of the term.They flat out refused any refund.  I am now out of pocket by nearly £200 for a product I do not want.  Unfathomable that they are happy to behave in such a way.  In addition, I've found the customer service to be dreadful.  Either don't reply or when they do they avoid the specific questions asked.  Never the same representative.  Would never recommend this platform or company to anyone.UPDATE: After a final push WIX gave me the prorated refund I requested. In light of this I think it's only fair to update the review from 1 to 3.
